t: Luke 11
Instruction about Prayer
It*p happened that while Jesus was praying in a certain place, after He had finished, one of His disciples said to Him, “Lord, teach us to pray just as John also taught his disciples.”
And He said to them, “When*r you*r pray,*r say:*r ‘Father,*rpn hallowed*r be*r Your*r name.*r Your*rln kingdom*r come.*r
Give*rln us*r each*r day*r our*r daily*r bread.*r
And*rln forgive*r us*r our*r sins,*r For*rln we*r ourselves*r also*r forgive*r everyone*r who*r is*r indebted*r to*r us.*r And*rln lead*r us*r not*r into*r temptation.’ ”*r
Then*p He said to them, “Suppose*r one*r of*r you*r has*r a*r friend,*r and*r goes*r to*r him*r at*r midnight*r and*r says*r to*r him,*r ‘Friend,*r lend*r me*r three*r loaves;*r
for*r a*r friend*r of*r mine*r has*r come*r to*r me*r from*r a*r journey,*r and*r I*r have*r nothing*r to*r set*r before*r him’;*r

and*r from*r inside*r he*r answers*r and*r says,*r ‘Do*r not*r bother*r me;*r the*r door*r has*r already*r been*r shut*r and*r my*r children*r and*r I*r are*r in*r bed;*r I*r cannot*r get*r up*r and*r give*r you*r anything.’*ir

For*r everyone*r who*r asks,*r receives;*r and*r he*r who*r seeks,*r finds;*r and*r to*r him*r who*r knocks,*r it*r will*r be*r opened.*r
Now*r suppose*r one*r of*r you*r fathers*r is*r asked*r by*r his*r son*r for*r a*r fish;*r he*r will*r not*r give*r him*r a*r snake*r instead*r of*r a*r fish,*r will*r he?*r

If*r you*r then,*r being*r evil,*r know*r how*r to*r give*r good*r gifts*r to*r your*r children,*r how*r much*r more*r will*r your*ir heavenly*r Father*r give*r the*r Holy*r Spirit*r to*r those*r who*r ask*r Him?”*r
Pharisees’ Blasphemy
And*p He was casting out a demon, and it was mute; when the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the crowds were amazed.
But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
Others, to test Him,*i were demanding of Him a sign from heaven.
But He knew their thoughts and said to them, “Any*r kingdom*r divided*r against*r itself*r is*r laid*r waste;*r and*r a*r house*r divided*ir against*r itself*r falls.*r
If*r Satan*r also*r is*r divided*r against*r himself,*r how*r will*r his*r kingdom*r stand?*r For*r you*r say*r that*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r by*r Beelzebul.*r
And*r if*r I*r by*r Beelzebul*r cast*r out*r demons,*r by*r whom*r do*r your*r sons*r cast*r them*r out?*r So*r they*r will*r be*r your*r judges.*r
But*r if*r I*r cast*r out*r demons*r by*r the*r finger*r of*r God,*r then*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r has*r come*r upon*r you.*r
When*r a*r strong*r man,*ir fully*r armed,*r guards*r his*r own*r house,*r his*r possessions*r are*r undisturbed.*r

But*r when*r someone*r stronger*r than*r he*r attacks*r him*r and*r overpowers*r him,*r he*r takes*r away*r from*r him*r all*r his*r armor*r on*r which*r he*r had*r relied*r and*r distributes*r his*r plunder.*r

Then*r it*r goes*r and*r takes*r along*ir seven*r other*r spirits*r more*r evil*r than*r itself,*r and*r they*r go*r in*r and*r live*r there;*r and*r the*r last*r state*r of*r that*r man*r becomes*r worse*r than*r the*r first.”*r

But He said, “On*r the*r contrary,*r blessed*r are*r those*r who*r hear*r the*r word*r of*r God*r and*r observe*r it.”*r
The Sign of Jonah

As*p the crowds were increasing, He began to say, “This*r generation*r is*r a*r wicked*r generation;*r it*r seeks*r for*r a*r sign,*r and*r yet*ir no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r it*r but*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonah.*r

The*r Queen*r of*r the*r South*r will*r rise*r up*r with*r the*r men*r of*r this*r generation*r at*r the*r judgment*r and*r condemn*r them,*r because*r she*r came*r from*r the*r ends*r of*r the*r earth*r to*r hear*r the*r wisdom*r of*r Solomon;*r and*r behold,*r something*r greater*r than*r Solomon*r is*r here.*r

The*r men*r of*r Nineveh*r will*r stand*r up*r with*r this*r generation*r at*r the*r judgment*r and*r condemn*r it,*r because*r they*r repented*r at*r the*r preaching*r of*r Jonah;*r and*r behold,*r something*r greater*r than*r Jonah*r is*r here.*r

The*r eye*r is*r the*r lamp*r of*r your*r body;*r when*r your*r eye*r is*r clear,*r your*r whole*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r light;*r but*r when*r it*r is*r bad,*r your*r body*r also*r is*r full*r of*r darkness.*r
Then*r watch*r out*r that*r the*r light*r in*r you*r is*r not*r darkness.*r

If*r therefore*r your*r whole*r body*r is*r full*r of*r light,*r with*r no*r dark*r part*r in*r it,*r it*r will*r be*r wholly*r illumined,*r as*r when*r the*r lamp*r illumines*r you*r with*r its*r rays.”*r
Woes upon the Pharisees
Now*p when He had spoken, a Pharisee asked Him to have lunch with him; and He went in, and reclined at*i the*i table.*i
When the Pharisee saw it, he was surprised that He had not first ceremonially washed before the meal.

But the Lord said to him, “Now*r you*r Pharisees*r clean*r the*r outside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r of*r the*r platter;*r but*r inside*r of*r you,*r you*r are*r full*r of*r robbery*r and*r wickedness.*r
You*r foolish*r ones,*r did*r not*r He*r who*r made*r the*r outside*r make*r the*r inside*r also?*r
But*r give*r that*r which*r is*r within*r as*r charity,*r and*r then*r all*r things*r are*r clean*r for*r you.*r

“But*rp woe*r to*r you*r Pharisees!*r For*r you*r pay*r tithe*r of*r mint*r and*r rue*r and*r every*r kind*ir of*ir garden*r herb,*r and*r yet*ir disregard*r justice*r and*r the*r love*r of*r God;*r but*r these*r are*r the*r things*r you*r should*r have*r done*r without*r neglecting*r the*r others.*r

Woe*r to*r you!*r For*r you*r are*r like*r concealed*r tombs,*r and*r the*r people*r who*r walk*r over*r them*ir are*r unaware*r of*ir it.”*ir
